subject: Education
title: The Attention Economy vs. Deep Learning
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Attention Economy vs. Deep Learning.

hook.text: Tech companies spend billions engineering apps to capture your attention. Schools get chalk and hope.

buildup.text: The attention economy monetizes human focusâ€”every app competes for the same limited resource.

discovery.text: Deep learning requires sustained focus, but the digital environment trains rapid context-switching.

twist.text: Students struggle with long-form readingâ€”not because they can't, but because they rarely practice.

climax.text: Education must now compete with the most addictive technology ever designed for student attention.

punchline.text: You can't learn deeply when everything is designed for shallow engagement.

quiz.question: How does the attention economy affect deep learning?
options: It trains rapid context-switching that undermines sustained focus for learning
It helps students become better multitaskers in school
The attention economy only affects adults, not students
